cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 535 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the southeastern Bahamas and the north coast of Cuba, then forecast to turn northwest and approach South Florida and the Florida Keys

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet, and north of Bonita Beach to Venice
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coastline from Jupiter Inlet through the Keys and around to southwest Florida
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) are very likely (93%); hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) have a 47% chance of occurring at the port with peak probabilities in about 60 hours.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Warning in place; advisory projects 3–6 ft inundation above ground from Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet, which includes the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible in southeast Florida, leading to flash-flood risk at and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and dangerous surf and rip currents; possible coastal flooding outside the surge zones; port operations also threatened by heavy seas and debris flow.
